item.description:
Every year, Criterion Cinema's in New Haven puts on a selection of the SHORT Films nominated for the Oscar Awards. 

I (A.J.) Plan to go to Wednesday Night's 7:20 showing of the Shorts in the Live Action Category.  Everyone is in charge of getting their own ticket.

I will plan to be at "Kelly's" just around the corner for a pre-film drink starting at around 6:30, and will start migration to the theater around 7:05. 

If you miss migration and do not see us in the lobby before going in, I will keep my phone (315-345-9348) on until they dim the lights, but after that you're on your own.

I have not made it out to them previous years, but it seemed cool to do as some thing a little different. These are SHORT films, not full length features, they're each in the 10-25 minute range. (So 5 of them add up to your normal full length feature time).

Again, I'm seeing the "Live Action" category on this evening, so be sure you get the right one as there is also a set of Animated and Documentaries.

If people wish to socialize about the films afterward, we can either do so in the lobby seating area or go back to Kelly's.  (It is a work night though, so I won't be out too late.)

Some thing to keep in mind: Everyone's got to start some where, and many great directors have had shorts nominated before they were famous for full length films.

Here's a list of the films they are supposed to be showing:

Pentecost (Peter McDonald and Eimear O'Kane)

Raju (Max Zähle and Stefan Gieren)

The Shore (Terry George and Oorlagh George)

Time Freak (Andrew Bowler and Gigi Causey)

Tuba Atlantic (Hallvar Witzø)
item.how_to_find_us: Look at Kelly's before hand or wait in the Lobby till 7:05. If you miss us you can try to call AJ before the lights Dim: 315-345-9348.
item.name: 2012 Oscar Shorts @ Criterion: Live Action Category, Drink before @ Kelly's
